channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘Stranger Things’ Has Ended. What Happened in the Series Finale?
item.description: There was a lot to tie up after five seasons and nearly 10 years, and the show gave itself another two hours to do it. Here are the major events.

item.title: A Year of Fires and Floods in Southern California
item.description: The floods that struck last week just before the first anniversary of the January wildfires show how extreme weather is defining life in the L.A. regi...

item.title: The Two Questions I Wish We’d Stop Asking in 2026
item.description: How did we get here? I don’t want to know.

item.title: Repeat Moviegoers Help Hollywood Eke Out a Slightly Better 2025
item.description: Ticket sales in North America totaled $8.9 billion for the year, up 2 percent from 2024. But the box office remains far below prepandemic levels.

item.title: He’s Chevy Chase, and He’s Still Like That

item.title: How Thousands of Secret Russian Documents Were Exposed
item.description: Russian journalists learned that a government office inadvertently made thousands of sensitive complaints viewable online, including accounts of abuse...

item.title: Live Updates: Dozens Believed Dead After Fire at New Year’s Party in Switzerland, Police Say
item.description: The fire broke out around 1:30 a.m. at a bar at the Crans-Montana ski resort. Roughly 100 people were injured in the overnight blaze, the Swiss police...

item.title: New Year’s 2026 Celebrations Around the World: Photos and Videos
item.description: See how people across the globe celebrated.

item.title: Dollar set for worst year since 2017 with Fed drama center stage
item.description: “The biggest factor for the dollar in first quarter will be the Fed,” said Yusuke Miyairi, a foreign-exchange strategist at Nomura.

item.title: Copper records biggest annual gain since 2009 on supply bets
item.description: The red metal has notched a series of all-time highs in an end-of-year surge, rallying 42% on the London Metal Exchange this year.

item.title: Canadian stocks set record for records in ‘jaw-dropping’ year
item.description: “The numbers themselves are somewhat jaw dropping,” said IG Wealth Management chief investment strategist Philip Petursson by phone.

item.title: Gold and silver stumble at the end of best year since the 1970s
item.description: “In my career, it’s unprecedented,” said John Reade, a market veteran and chief strategist at the World Gold Council.
